sentences.en: A cricket an inch long has a chirp that is audible for nearly a mile.
sentences.cn: 一英寸长的蟋蟀发出的唧唧声在将近一英里远的地方都能听见.

sentences.en: Birds had begun to chirp among the trees.
sentences.cn: 鸟儿们已经开始在树林里叽叽喳喳地叫了.

sentences.en: Birds had begun to chirp and twitter among the trees.
sentences.cn: 鸟儿开始在树丛中啁啾鸣啭.

sentences.en: Chirp up the chirp is played from start frequency to the end frequency.
sentences.cn: 短促声波开始短促声波从起动频率对结束频率播放.

sentences.en: Constabulary bate, blow alarm chirp comes check, captain is obliged to halt the car.
sentences.cn: 警察大怒, 吹起警哨赶来制止, 上尉只得把车停住.

sentences.en: Finch had regular flying, and closed to chirp to a person.
sentences.cn: 有鸟雀常飞来飞去, 叽叽喳喳着于人亲近.

sentences.en: It begins quietly; like the chirp of a track signalling the distant approach of a train.
sentences.cn: 事情很平静地开始了, 就像火车从远处到来以前,铁轨上发出的低微的嗡嗡声.

sentences.en: Now it is clearing up, and a sparrow is beginning to chirp.
sentences.cn: 现在天就要晴了, 一只麻雀已开始喳喳地叫.

sentences.en: Only male cicadas chirp in late summer, and early autumn.
sentences.cn: 只有雄性的寒蝉在夏末秋初时鸣叫.

sentences.en: The birds chirp merrily at the top of tree.
sentences.cn: 鸟儿在枝头欢快地啾啾鸣唱.

sentences.en: The chirps of the garden birds sounded distant.
sentences.cn: 花园的鸟鸣听上去那样的遥远。

sentences.en: The crickets chirped faster and louder.
sentences.cn: 蟋蟀叫得越来越快，越来越响。

sentences.en: The sparrows chirp outside the window every morning.
sentences.cn: 麻雀每天清晨在窗外嘁嘁喳喳地叫.

sentences.en: They are basically quiet cats in voice, however they do trill, chirp and click when delighted.
sentences.cn: 在声音上它们基本算得上安静, 然而高兴时它们会发颤音 、 唧唧声和短而轻的声音.

sentences.en: This approach can also extend the transmission distance by reducing the transient chirp.
sentences.cn: 这个方法同时降低雷射的暂态啁啾值,因此也可以延伸传输距离.

sentences.en: When a prairie dog senses danger it begins to chirp and retreat to its burrow.
sentences.cn: 当草原土拔鼠感到不安的时候,它就开始吱吱叫然后撤回到它的地洞里.

sentences.en: You couldn't see a thread of green or hear a single chirp of insect or bird.
sentences.cn: 这里,找不到一株绿色植物,听不到一声鸟虫鸣.

words.tran_cn: 快活的；活泼的；啁啾叫的
快活地，活泼地；喳喳叫地
唧唧声；喳喳声；[通信]啁啾声
吱喳而鸣；尖声地说；咂嘴打招呼

trans.tran_en: if a bird or insect chirps, it makes short high sounds
